vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
σαπρός, ά, όν,
(σήπω) rotten, putrid, [Refs 6th c.BC+]; of the lungs, diseased, [Refs]; of bone, carious, [Refs]; of wood, etc., rotten, ἱστίον [Refs 5th c.BC+]; πινακίσκος, φορμός, σχοινίον, [Refs 4th c.BC+]; τοῦ διατειχίσματος ἀνελόντι τὰ σ. [Refs]; of a house, σ. καὶ ῥέουσα καὶ καταπίπτουσα Telesp.27 H.; ἐλαῖαι [Refs 6th c.BC+]: especially, of fish that have been long in pickle, stale, rancid, τάριχος [Refs 5th c.BC+]; opposed to πρόσφατος, [Refs 4th c.BC+]; of withered flowers, [Refs 4th c.BC+] adverb, -ρῶς λούει τὰ βαλανεῖα so as to leave one filthy, [Refs 2nd c.AD+]
__II generally, stale, worn out, ἀρχαῖον καὶ σαπρόν [Refs 5th c.BC+]; of clothes, [Refs 2nd c.AD+] adverb, -ῶς (perhaps misspelt for -ός) περιπατῶ I am walking about in rags, [Refs 2nd c.AD+]
__II.2 of persons, γέρων ὢν καὶ σ. [Refs 5th c.BC+]; ὦ σαπρά, to an old woman, [Refs 5th c.BC+]; οὐδέν ἐσμεν οἱ σ. [Refs 5th c.BC+]
__II.3 of wine, mellow (compare σαπρίας), [Refs 5th c.BC+]; of old wine, ὀδόντας οὐκ ἔχων, ἤδη σαπρὸς.., γέρων γε δαιμονίως [Refs 2nd c.AD+]
__II.4 εἰρήνη σαπρά, a joke παρὰ προσδοκίαν, [Refs 5th c.BC+]
__II.5 metaphorically, unsound, bad, λόγος [NT]; opposed to καλός, [Refs 2nd c.AD+]; ἄρουραι [Refs 2nd c.AD+]; τὰ σ. ταῦτα [Refs 1st c.AD+]; τὴν σ. εἱμαρμένην the evil fate, [Refs]
__III of sound, αὐλεῖ γὰρ σαπρὰ.. κρουμάτια [Refs 5th c.BC+]
vocabInfos.mediumDef:
bad, rotten, decayed; unwholesome
primarily rotten, decayed, putrid; hence, bad, of a bad quality, Mt. 7:17, 18; 12:33; Lk. 6:43; refuse, Mt. 13:48; metaphorically corrupt, depraved, vicious, foul, impure, unwholesome Eph. 4:29*
vocabInfos._es_Definition: malo, podrido, deplorable, sin valor ; mala o dañina (palabra)
vocabInfos._zh_tw_Definition:
1) 腐敗發臭 (經外含意)
2) 品質卑劣的
3) 壞的, 惡的 (弗 4:29)
vocabInfos._zh_Definition:
1) 腐败发臭 (经外含意)
2) 品质卑劣的
3) 坏的, 恶的 (弗 4:29)
